titleInfo.title: INCLUSION OF ALL FUNDS WHEN ISSUING CERTAIN GEOGRAPHIC TARGETING ORDERS

extension.searchTitle: INCLUSION OF ALL FUNDS WHEN ISSUING CERTAIN GEOGRAPHIC TARGETING ORDERS; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 111

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Amending title 31, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to include all �D772�funds when issuing certain geographic targeting orders
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 5602, to amend title 31, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to include all funds when issuing certain geographic targeting orders, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 356 yeas to 47 nays, Roll No. 401;

extension.searchTitle: ENHANCING TREASURY'S ANTI-TERROR TOOLS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 111

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 5607, amended, to enhance the Department of the Treasury's role in protecting national security, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 362 yeas to 45 nays, Roll No. 402;

titleInfo.title: ANTI-TERRORISM INFORMATION SHARING IS STRENGTH ACT

extension.searchTitle: ANTI-TERRORISM INFORMATION SHARING IS STRENGTH ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 111

congVote.result: So (two-thirds not being in the affirmative) the motion was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Anti-terrorism Information Sharing Is Strength Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House failed to agree to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:�D773�<P/>H.R. 5606, to facilitate better information sharing to assist in the fight against the funding of terrorist activities, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 229 yeas to 177 nays, Roll No. 403.

The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 5607, amended, to enhance the Department of the Treasury's role in protecting national security, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 362 yeas to 45 nays, Roll No. 402;
